name: places/ChIJby9HQXz2wokRIJ2_T06Tah8
formattedAddress: 734 St Nicholas Ave, New York, NY 10031, USA
adrFormatAddress: 734 St Nicholas Ave, New York, NY 10031, USA

originalText.text: My boyfriend took our dog here to get groomed. The front desk was so nice and I was able to meet the groomer, also very nice. She asked me if I had any questions or concerned before dropping off our son. Very reassuring. The only reason I don’t give it a full 5 stars is because of the wait time. I wish the wait time was communicated before booking the appointment just to plan better on our end. However, it wasn’t the end of the world and the front desk did a good job at answering our phone calls when  we were checking in and confirming when our boy was actually ready.

originalText.text: Today was our 3rd visit with Alexis and once again she nailed my baby’s groom. He gets so much compliments. I have referred all my poodle moms to Harlem Doggie Day Spa. Great customer service and friendly. Love entering a place where people are genuinely nice.

text.text: Today was our 3rd visit with Alexis and once again she nailed my baby’s groom. He gets so much compliments. I have referred all my poodle moms to Harlem Doggie Day Spa. Great customer service and friendly. Love entering a place where people are genuinely nice.

originalText.text:
I’d like to start by saying I loved how welcoming everyone was upon my arrival. I had a few requests for what I wanted for my dog Max’s groom. I requested short ears, a close trim to his paws & for his body to be trimmed down slightly as he came in already short.

When coming back for pickup, I instinctively said I was fine with his cut. But after some inspection I have to admit he was a bit short for my liking. I know my description for his cut may have not been the best but I’m learning. I do feel like some parts were not blended & a bit choppy as well. His ears did not appear to be cleaned but Brian fixed that very quickly w/ no issues. I appreciated that greatly.

I do feel like the $130 pricing was a bit steep for the end product I received but overall, it wasn’t a bad experience. This was my first time here but looking on the bright side I won’t have to worry about his next cut for a few months. I’m glad about that!

text.text:
I’d like to start by saying I loved how welcoming everyone was upon my arrival. I had a few requests for what I wanted for my dog Max’s groom. I requested short ears, a close trim to his paws & for his body to be trimmed down slightly as he came in already short.

When coming back for pickup, I instinctively said I was fine with his cut. But after some inspection I have to admit he was a bit short for my liking. I know my description for his cut may have not been the best but I’m learning. I do feel like some parts were not blended & a bit choppy as well. His ears did not appear to be cleaned but Brian fixed that very quickly w/ no issues. I appreciated that greatly.

I do feel like the $130 pricing was a bit steep for the end product I received but overall, it wasn’t a bad experience. This was my first time here but looking on the bright side I won’t have to worry about his next cut for a few months. I’m glad about that!

originalText.text: Alexis did a great job!!!  She really listened to my request and went above and beyond.   My baby went in a wet mess and came out shining.  Now he is ready for the holidays and I love his haircut!

text.text: Alexis did a great job!!!  She really listened to my request and went above and beyond.   My baby went in a wet mess and came out shining.  Now he is ready for the holidays and I love his haircut!

originalText.text: My dog quite literally runs to the doors of Harlem Doggie Day Spa and doesn't look back at drop-off, which is a relief for any pet parent who wants their dog in great hands while they are traveling or away. The staff are friendly, I love the "paw-gress" reports, and my dog always returns to me healthy and happy. I cannot recommend HDDS enough for daycare, boarding, or grooming.
